intro: Webera fasciculata, commonly known as the clustered webera, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Webera fasciculata is often found in moist, shaded areas such as forests and along stream banks.
